snippet: Recognition as a writer eluded Mrs. Howitt until a diary she had kept as a teenager was discovered in a trash bin in 2003.

headline.main: Florence Wolfson Howitt, Famed for Rediscovered Diary, Dies at 96
headline.print_headline: Florence Wolfson Howitt, Famed for Rediscovered Diary, Dies at 96

snippet: “Make Mine Manhattan,” a sweet little revue first produced in 1948, is being revived at the Connelly Theater in a scaled-down version by UnsungMusicalsCo.

headline.main: A Vintage Skyline Filled With Valentines and Air Kisses
headline.print_headline: A Vintage Skyline Filled With Valentines and Air Kisses

snippet: Is it time to boycott Apple? Sweatshop opposition in the past offers limited hope, but consumer pressure has already led Apple to make some big changes.
abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column comments on consumer pressure that led Apple to make some changes in labor practices that labor activists called abusive and that contrasted with company's public image, the allure of its coveted products, and its huge profits; says outcry raises a more important question of whether or not pressure by consumers and governments in the West actually improves conditions.

headline.main: Dividends Emerge in Pressing Apple Over Working Conditions in China
headline.print_headline: Dividends In Pressing Apple Over Labor

snippet: Being a visionary leader, or at least thinking you are, can propel corporate chieftains to great heights, but it can also lead to extreme narcissism. And the victims are often shareholders.
abstract: Being a visionary leader, or at least thinking you are, can propel corporate chieftains to great heights, but it can also lead to extreme narcissism. And the victims are often shareholders.

headline.main: A Mirror Can Be a Dangerous Tool for Some C.E.O.'s
headline.print_headline: For Some C.E.O.’s, a Mirror Can Become a Dangerous Tool

snippet: Google is transforming its Android Marketplace into Google Play, a one-stop shop for its collections of e-books, music and applications.
abstract: Google is transforming its Android Marketplace into Google Play, a one-stop shop for its collections of e-books, music and applications.

headline.main: Google Revamps Android Marketplace as Google Play

snippet: Square, the mobile payments network, will begin the rollout of a new payment method in the back of New York taxis. It will allow passengers to swipe their credit cards at any point in the ride, well before the trip has ended.
abstract: Square, the mobile payments network, will begin the rollout of a new payment method in the back of New York taxis. It will allow passengers to swipe their credit cards at any point in the ride, well before the trip has ended.

headline.main: With New Hardware, Square Begins Taxi Rollout

snippet: Kindle Singles are works of long-form journalism that seek out that sweet spot between magazine articles and hardcover books.

headline.main: Miniature E-Books Let Journalists Stretch Legs
headline.print_headline: Miniature E-Books Let Journalists Stretch Legs

snippet: The new version of the iPad will not be made public until Wednesday, when Apple unveils the device at an event in San Francisco. But that has not stopped speculation on what it will look like, and even what it might be named.
abstract: The new version of the iPad will not be made public until Wednesday, when Apple unveils the device at an event in San Francisco. But that has not stopped speculation on what it will look like, and even what it might be named.

headline.main: Daily Report: Imagining the New iPad

snippet: The executive who helped Apple make its initial foray into mobile advertising, Lars Albright, on Tuesday will announce a new start-up, SessionM, that adds video-game-like tricks to mobile advertisements to engage users. Mobile apps with the advert...
abstract: The executive who helped Apple make its initial foray into mobile advertising, Lars Albright, on Tuesday will announce a new start-up, SessionM, that adds video-game-like tricks to mobile advertisements to engage users. Mobile apps with the advertisements will let consumers earn points for using the app regularly, watching a certain number of videos and doing other activities.

headline.main: Former Apple Executive Plots Next Wave of Mobile Ads

snippet: Wariness led to a sharp sell-off after China lowered its growth forecast and worry about Greece continued.
abstract: Stocks suffer their biggest losses in three months, the first interruption in a steady rally that started at the beginning of the year, amid concerns about the global economy and Greece's bailout woes.

headline.main: Shares Dive on Concern About Global Economy
headline.print_headline: Shares Dive on Concern About Global Economy
